top: Mass. The U.S. unemployment rate dropped to 7.9% in September, but hiring is slowing and many Americans have given up looking for work, the government said Friday, Oct. 2, in the final jobs report before the voters decide whether to give President Donald Trump another term.
The unemployment rate dropped last month for all races — to 7% for whites, 12.1% for Black workers and 10.3% for Hispanic Americans.

The number of new temporary jobs in the United States dropped to 8,100 in September, down from 101,500 in August and the lowest such gain since the job market collapsed in April after the viral pandemic erupted.
